Entries:

 

         I was tweaking the other day, and I discovered the universe is finite, at the moment it contradicted with my view of the expanding universe, but on recent thinking I understand how an expanding universe is a finite one, an infinite universe will need no expanding.

 

         An important excerpt from today’s reading of the skepticism course:  What you believe is what you see. The label is the behaviour. Theory moulds data, and concepts determine percepts.

Devotional: TURN HAVE TO INTO GET TO

 

Poem of the Day: Solitude by Ella Wheeler Wilcox

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         I discovered reading the skeptic course that my rare jolt; bout of waking up suddenly remaining a feeling of being about to fall is actually a form of paralysis.

Devotional: PROTECT THE FLAME

 

Poem of the Day: For You O Democracy Walt Whitman

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

Son To Mother

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         These past few years have been an inoculation so repetitive and severe; I’ve become . . . I remain dissenting.

 

         I’ve got a crush on Jessica Andreas, ah . . . if she breaks my heart, I’ll be hurt, I hope it doesn’t take as long as it did to ger over Stephanie—if I’m over her—I remember saying to a friend:  hey, just give it six months, I’ll be fine.  It took me a decade. Hush, tell no one. Well, I’m kinda in love, you know, I feel a certain way; that warm throb that engulfs you like a swirling flame. I miss her, even though knowing what’s like to be with her, her brief instances; of her post. If I lose this, I’ll chalk it up in experience, raise my stained boots and munch up my pride.

 

         I’ve been turned inside out, growing sick in the air, connected to people who dislike me, some who love me, most who revere me, in all I remain inside out, a match with constant strike outs, a bible of tallied meaning.

 

         An important except from the book The Stoic Challenge, paraphrased:  The Framing Effect - How we mentally characterize a situation has a profound impact on how we respond to it emotionally. The Stoics realized that we have considerable flexibility in how we frame the situations we experience. Their goal wasn’t to banish emotion but to minimize the number of negative emotions. It is tempting, at this point, to describe the Stoics as patient people, and indeed they were, but a caveat is in order. In one sense, a patient person is one who can suffer a setback without complaint. This is not, however, what the Stoics were doing. Their goal was not to remain calm while suffering a setback but rather to experience a setback without thereby suffering. 

 

         When my second younger sibling comes to mind, I should think of freedom of assembly. She has the right to whatever she pleases; the crowd she wills to be part of. Forgive myself for the times spent harbouring thoughts of disparity.

 

         Another excerpt: One sign of maturity is a realization of the extent to which you, either intentionally or unintentionally, make life difficult for those around you. We are bad men living among bad men; and only one thing can calm us—we must agree to go easy on one another.

Known To Eve And Me

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         The curse of knowledge: in which better-informed people find it difficult to think about problems from the perspective of lesser-informed people. Once you know something, you can’t un-know it, and knowing it influences how you interpret it.

Devotional: RISE AND SHINE

 

Poem of the Day: Rain in Summer by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

These Yet To Be United States

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         I need to be more dangerous than anyone around me; my environment.

 

         I was seeing a video on the  Twin Paradox , a brief analyzation of Einstein’s theory of relativity, understanding the concept of how the reference point remains with the observer and every other thing moves around. I figured hey, the lecture came to meet me and just for a mad unnecessary titbit of nonsensical data, at 9:13 he points at me; and it sticks! I get it. He’s mad he came to me lol. Thanks teacher.

Devotional: OUR DUTY TO LEARN

 

Poem of the Day: Checking Out Me History by John Agard

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

Me And My Work

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         Thinking of all that’s happened, and how my will to fight for life has dwindled, today’s devotional reading says to keep the able stride on, not to give in, to learn the right thing; leave with what counts. I hope I can carry on, for my heart is weak and my strength is far spent, and my love is washed away. I have no face to fight for the man who stands next to me for my resolve has been lost. In the event of my death, if its suicide, I hope these words never get to anyone.

 

         I miss high-school, singing hymns, my girlfriend up there leading the assembly, thoughts of our last smooch, always the night before, and her sweet Christian praises. Had this go through my head while seeing a movie.

 

         Banshee’s mum is a stupid person, who just like the other Scrompus, the stupid bitch who has life in the mist gone has lost her mind. She bears no consequence on her actions and just like my mum’s kids. Her’s will bear the burden if they don’t wake to the reality of things. No one is ever high enough to fall.

 

         I discovered the concept of  curse of knowledge  reviewing the last chapter read from the Skepticism course and I’m thinking—as my blood flows, strewing veins that transit stuff of the gods—how biased have I become? Away from my resolve, mindless, by the planes of the outskirts of my inferential know. See, this is a bit tawny—as it were—a mix of the brown and the yellow. Figuring out  what is what?  Am I the brown? Is that what I would have volitionally willed? My propensity? Or am I the yellow, the obvious? Or still, am I somewhere in there, in the discrete, lost in the composition, forever lost in the world of labels, caught away in a colour? To figure these things out, I’ll need to understand this concept—Curse of Knowledge—and how I can better delineate who I am, or at least, what I choose to stand for, what counts for an improvement, and what sits as corruption, knowing there is a normal psychology of belief that allows for outside influences.

 

         Body on heads, still my skin is dry and ugly. Head over body, still I count a twine at its turns. I’m sick and I can get no help, still I’m my help. Body on heads. I’ll keep safe.

 

         Thinking of it; all the trouble I go through during the day. The only time I’m ever down or sad at my existence is when I wake up. Waking up in a ditch-bed, a subtle strong reminder of remiss; waking up from mortal  sleep  after I took that cup of shaving powder that should have ended this existence. The after fact of my inability to down it when I should have, quite early, following its preparation, part hunts me every morning. A reinitiation into the turmoils of my life here need not be beard, I’m tired, and a misuse of an opportunity is light of cowardice. These things should be written, reread, understood, so in the relapse to the phase of not being able to endanger the existence that holds bare in a life of wondrous things, I’ll pull off my tie, say I fought a good one, and all things like my life, must come to an end.

 

         Sometimes hackneyed words are meant. Regardless you should always call people on their bullshit.

 

         An excerpt from the course on Skepticism:  Once we have an idea in our minds about something, we notice only evidence that confirms the idea and are blind to evidence that disconfirms it. 

 

         The intentions behind this entry are frazzled and worn out, reason, I have spoken on them countless times. My mum is sick and I think it’s born out of a loss of a lot, I can’t begin to list them all, but one idea would be a neglect of what is important.

 

         Most audiobooks are just filled with cynicism.

 

         Just thinking of this same audiobook, it has me thinking how in the undulation of history, a lot of books are lost in the tides of history, never to make it to the halls of the classic. I also think the cynicism is a call to attention, to listen to what is being said. 

 

         This is a twist of fate, another input included on 16:41, 24th July 2021. I currently am seeing the  The Long Pond Studio Sessions  and discovering the lyric from the song  seven  that reads:

 Please picture me 

 In the trees 

 I hit my peak at seven feet 

 In the swing 

 Over the creek 

 I was too scared to jump in 

 But I, I was high in the sky 

 With Pennsylvania under me 

 Are there still beautiful things? 

 Trees  like  blue  means conversation to me.

 

         Line seven holds my favourite, repetitions I have come now to bear a match with  you and I , line  five  first is of interest, it’s a brace of the   withholding of affirmation as I blurted the line:

 

 Hitch this shit together 

 Like lil locked up 

 Like creek or leather 

 … I might just listen 

 … the error 

 

         The most important line to the epiphany in expression is line  four , (also numero uno) great braid pattern: poem  19 :  meeting a girl is like swinging a set.  Weird how since I wrote these poems, numbers now carry some personal meaning. I especially like the time-lines:  02:44 ,  02:47 .

 

         02:44: reads  clue  on  shitFreestyle,  same number of words in the mentioned poem. 44th day poem is  home , 44th poem in the series is  every  from day 33.

 

         02:47: reads  together,  the number of words in  half blue pod , interesting. LOL. The 47th day poem is  electric.  The 47th poem in the series is Charly Cox. LOL: Familial.

Televised

 

Today's Musical: FELIX MENDELSSOHN [1809 - 1847] - SONGS WITHOUT WORDS ( OPUS 19 NO. 1 IN E MAJOR )

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         Today marks the first day of my use of the daily reference book: Year of Wonder, and today’s musical is by Jakob Ludwig Felix Mendelssohn-Bartholdy, German musician and romantic composer of orchestral and choral works, who was born today 1809, died 1847.

 

         The distended bellies of the starving cows, OMG how many cows do I know?

 

         I wrote a Haiku for Jessica, it goes:

 

 In the event Jess  

 Seat next to seat don’t warm hearts 

 Miss only, the corn. 


 

         Just as I was about writing the next one some dude calls saying he’s pastor Olofin, a call for my mum, well I think Olofin is pronounced the way he did as a kind of euphemism. It may mean something else, that I don’t know.

Another haiku for my crush Jessica

 Cock-a-doodle-doo 

 You sprout my sombre heart bloom 

 With sultry tunes um . . . 


Another one:

 Clocks ticking through lines 

 Heels missing on the right side 

 Heaven waits here now 

   

 If it is, isn’t 

 Lead me on beyond ends wait 

 Mirth taste in your gait 

   

         I have been fvcking jinxed, I'm in love with a pop star. OMG! 

 

         I want to write another, but I guess I should know when to stop.

So here is another:

 Whistle kiss issues 

 Your music my soul crush in 

 Like pestle thuds. 

Five Haikus now, I couldn’t pen down one on valentine’s day, and here I am, with five in the name of love.

Devotional: THE START-UP OF YOU

 

Poem of the Day: The Duel by Eugene Field

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

Nothing Much

 

Today's Musical: ELLA FITZGERALD LOUIS ARMSTRONG BESS, YOU IS MY WOMAN NOW

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         I’ve been Lazy all day, laying lazy even though today’s devotional talks about the start-up of self. I guess this is mine, I took half a pill earlier this morning to sleep, took the other this morning after breakfast, I guess that’s why I’m this way. It’s 3:05 PM. I guess I’ll be filling my responsibilities. This morning was exciting, so I was on twitter, woke up around 2:03 A.M, and loading up twitter, with three minutes in, Jessica’s account records an activity, and I used the opportunity to post my Haikus. In minutes, she tweets saying something about, being about it. Here is the tweet:  don’t say it if you don’t fucking mean it. 

 

         I was a bit confounded, thought of it a while. Do I post something, saying I tried to taper off the effect of my honest words? But then I’d be insecure all my life if I did that, I didn’t post anything. I took my mind off it, surfed YouTube a while. I later switched tabs, and saw she posted a picture, one of a couple or a date pair at a table having ice-cream from a goblet in a saucer, on closer look-up I realized it’s a shot from a 2001 movie called  Serendipity . I downloaded, but it isn’t complete yet. Well, what I guess is, the former tweet wasn’t for me. I guess she meant it for someone else. I’ll guess she’d rather have us go out on that kinda date than a cinema. My post might be off a bit, it’s because I’m just somewhere, lol.

 

         I’m adding this entry as a means, a reminder; a way of getting back to this important statement from the composer Felix Mendelssohn on the debate of music and its nature of meaning, it says:  What the music I love expresses to me is not thought too indefinite to put to words but too definite to put to words . This sentiment flies in the face of those who have declared that music is too abstract to have an actual meaning, what the narrator ensues from this is  if a piece moves you in a certain way, brings to mind certain images or stories, it doesn’t matter if what you’re interpreting is what was intended, if it gives you what the incident might call many feels, it means what it means .

 

         This input is important for reasons that don’t necessary matter to me, but still will be elucidated in full for its pleasure; disambiguation. The name Wiayu and its connote is now a thing for folks, apart from the fact that it’s a song by Skrillex and Diplo feat Justin Bieber off of the Jack U album, the album that says instead of doing drugs, why not do some Jack U - listen to the album - is now used in certain circles as a taboo word. Just this morning I called my friend and he refused to reply me when I asked where he was, pretending not to hear me, this isn’t the first time, it’s been of incidence. My only reason for calling this out, is my stumbling on the concept of Diffeomorphism Invariance, meaning  what’s going on at a point in space depends only on that point, and not where it’s located, nor what’s happening at other points . This might not necessarily tie things together directly, but from a cognition level in lieu of the former, I’d like this post to remain as a reference. Bear in mind that Diffeomorphism Invariance is based on the concept of Loop Quantum Gravity and this, has no confirming data.

 

         I need to reboot my devotional, I mean living the maxims, whether it calls me out, admonishes or advises me.

 

         So in a lecture about loop quantum gravity, Dr Don Lincoln is wearing a shirt with Einstein on it with his tongue out and his left eyebrow looking avian like, its plain funny.

Devotional: SOME SIMPLE RULES

 

Poem of the Day: Jerusalem (from Milton) by William Blake

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

Glory Falls

 

Today's Musical: NOCTURNO, OP. 7 BY FRANZ STRAUSS (1822–1905)

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         The preface to today’s poem, I quote it here for its beauty.

 

          The Stolen and Perverted Writings of Homer & Ovid, of Plato & Cicero, which all men ought to contemn, are set up by artifice against the Sublime of the Bible; but when the New Age is at leisure to Pronounce, all will be set right, & those Grand Works of the more ancient & consciously & professedly Inspired Men will hold their proper rank, & the Daughters of Memory shall become the Daughters of Inspiration. Shakspeare & Milton were both curb’d by the general malady & infection from the silly Greek & Latin slaves of the Sword. 

 

          Rouze up, 0 Young Men of the New Age! set your foreheads against the ignorant Hirelingsl For we have Hirelings in the Camp, the Court & the University, who would, if they could, for ever depress Mental & prolong Corporeal War. Painters! on you I call. Sculptors! Architects! Suffer not the fashonable Fools to depress your powers by the prices they pretend to give for contemptible works, or the expensive advertizing boasts that they make of such works; believe Christ & his Apostles that there is a Class of Men whose whole delight is in Destroying. We do not want either Greek or Roman Models if we are but just & true to our own Imaginations, those Worlds of Eternity in which we shall live for ever in JESUS OUR LORD. 

 

         I’ve been reading the book on Stoicism by the same author of my Daily devotional,  The Stoic Challenge - William B. Irvine . And I found this important point referenced from a book been spoken about, it’s called  On Death and Dying by Elisabeth KüblerRoss  and here it is quoted:  The five stages of grief: denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and finally, acceptance. These were the stages, she said, that those diagnosed with a terminal illness typically go through—and the stages that these individuals should go through to effectively deal with grief.  I’ll be downloading this book, dealing with the voices, I feel like I’ve gone through these stages, in order to get a more nuanced healing; understanding, I’ll be getting this book.

Devotional: A LEADER LEADS

 

Poem of the Day: The Argument of His Book by Robert Herrick

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

London

 

Today's Musical: STRING QUARTET IN G MAJOR, OP. 76 NO. 1 1: ALLEGRO CON SPIRITO BY JOSEPH HAYDN (1732–1809)

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         Back at my time at Wiayu, the ingenuous me, easily trusting, quick to embrace everyone’s motive as of good intention. How do I move forward from here? How do I tread the line between being a cynic and being receptive?

 

         In today’s musical, I discovered Joseph Haydn, a great composer of the 18th century, I’ll be getting his works, it’s said—there is a piece of string quartet for every mood.

 

         The habit of brushing “scruffy” nose, a carefree attitude towards immediate urgency, that’s what it is. The need for having a proper way of heuristic learning, memory aiding, mnemonics maybe? I need to figure other methods of remembering. Putting markers on things as store. When I can’t control these agents, it won’t work in remembering, maybe comprehending not remembering.

 

         My heart is still broken as it were, and this feeling I have for Jessica is going nowhere.

 

         A quote from the book Messiah quoting Jung:  When we analyse the persona we strip off the mask, and discover that what seemed to be individual is at bottom collective; in other words, that the persona was only a mask of the collective psyche. Fundamentally the persona is nothing real: it is a compromise between individual and society as to what a man should appear to be . . . The persona is a semblance, a two-dimensional reality, to give it a nickname. 

 

         A psychological instrument in the Stoic tool kit is negative visualization. It’s imperative involves making a point of imagining ways in which my life could be worse. It is important to realize that in advising me to negatively visualize, the Stoics aren’t advocating that I dwell on how things could be worse; that would indeed be a recipe for misery. Instead, what I should do is periodically have flickering thoughts about how my life and circumstance could be worse.

Entries:

 

         I wrote a prose for Jessica yesterday, after causing an uproar, posting more than I usually do, I ended up deleting all my post, now the first post on her Instagram is her in a brown gown. Here is the post I wrote for her.

 

 Jess every shade of you is my bower, 

 A synergy of pat showery moods, 

 Soaking me up in misty bliss 

 Evanescent, sensational. 

 You’re my cuddle turf, 

 My fraught lust 

 A posit point.

Devotional: WHEN GOOD MEN DO NOTHING

 

Poem of the Day: Watching My Dog Sleep by Kate Tempest

 

Collected Poems of Maya Angelou:

They Ask Why

 

Today's Musical: DÉPLORATION SUR LA MORT DE JEHAN OCKEGHEM BY JOSQUIN DES PREZ (C. 1450–1521)

 

 

 

 

Entries:

 

         Where do I start? It has been all hell. I would be denying the much-awaited awakening I deserve if I refuse to admit the loss from the days spent away from my journal. This rain had a reaction out of a lure, and still as I type this, I must run away to see her pictures, like a fiend.

 

         Today is a day of reckoning, I am back to my ways—reading—and it is obvious how far I have strayed, as my reading has become slow and my attention has lost its focus, I’m transfixed by this.

 

         I have deleted her pictures, videos, I’m not happy, I even lost all need for listening to my daily poems. It happened on a morning I set out for the text for the daily poem, I couldn’t find the text in any of the search results so I went for a video, the account read Mr. Butler and that was it, I got engulfed by the laziness it incited. In time I found the enemy, the game-mind saying quietly to go against the grain, when the poem says true, it quietly whispers false, now I must say bye. Now I know, truly I’m all alone, and this is the way it will remain, I certainly feel washed away as I wrote as a comment to a post of Jessica.

 

         Logic could be right or false, here is the definition of logic.  Logic is the systematic study of the   forms of inference  , the relations that lead to the acceptance of one proposition; the conclusion, on the basis of a set of other propositions; the premises. More broadly, logic is the analysis and appraisal of deductive arguments.   The premises may or may not support the conclusion  ; when they do not,   the relation   is characterized as a fallacy. it deals with inferences whose validity can be traced back to the formal features of the representations that are involved in that inference, be they linguistic, mental, or other representations.

Entries:

 

         A post of I and Jessica coincided this morning, some serendipity, right?

 

         The angle 90 concept by the game-mind is more or less the concept of the  as it were , a close connotation of self -subjective inference.

 

         From today’s listening of the John Green podcast Anthropocene I come across this quote by Herman Melville:  Is it that by its indefiniteness it shadows forth the heartless voids and immensities of the universe, and thus stabs us from behind with the thought of annihilation, when beholding the white depths of the milky way? Or is it, that as in essence whiteness is not so much a color as the visible absence of color, and at the same time the concrete of all colors; is it for these reasons that there is such a dumb blankness, full of meaning, in a wide landscape of snows -- a colorless, all- color of atheism from which we shrink? 

 

         Today 1914, the first world war started.
